= Formato fichero sbb =

SBB  (Stream of Binary Blocks)

A SBB file has one header and blocks of data to be loaded


==Header Format==



||position||field name|| type||comment||
||0..2 ||sbb_version|| char(3)||always "SB" + version number (2.0=0x20)|| 
||3..6 ||machine|| char(4)||ZX , CPC , MSX||
||7 ||model|| char ||model 48k, +2A. 464 ...||
||8..15 ||extre_info|| char(8)||Ready  For Future Uses||
||16..31 || name|| char(16)||name||
||24 || locate|| char||Most Significative Byte for the address of loading rutine||
||25 || origin|| char|| sbb was built from tap, bin , sna ...||
||26 || n_blocks|| char||number of blocks ||
||26 || poke_ffff|| char||msx pagination (if 0, Poke -1 is not modified)||
||27..29|| clear || short || clear or SP (if 0, SP is not modified) || 
||30..31|| n_usr|| short || execution address (if 0, it is not an executable block ) ||      
        


==Block format==

bloques
||position||field name|| type||comment||
||0..15||blockname|| char (16) || description||
||16..17||size|| short ||number of data bytes ||
||18..19||param3|| short || aux parammter ||
||20||block_type|| char|| type||
||21||h_chksum|| char|| checksum for header of block ((ini-1) XOR jump XOR exec)  ||
||22..23||ini|| short || start memory address for data ||
||24||jump|| char||  0xC3 or 0xCD for an execuable block||
||25..26||exec|| short || execution address for block. If zero is not executable||
||27||d_chksum|| char || checksum for data ||
||28..size+28||data || char (size) || memory block||
